alert.note: Alert for Washington (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 7:06AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and/or snowmelt and/or ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Vermont, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 702 AM EST, The Mad River at Moretown gage continues to indicate the potential for ice jam related flooding along the Mad River from near Warren to Waitsfield to Moretown over the next couple of hours. Flooding is ongoing or expected to occur shortly in the warned area. - Precipitation has changed to snow sleet and snow in the region. Additional rainfall is not expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Waitsfield, Fayston, Moretown, Duxbury, Warren, Middlesex, South Duxbury and Irasville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
